1500263606860103683.text: I commend @Mastercard and @Visa for their decision to suspend operations in Russia. This is an important step to demonstrate to  Vladimir Putin our unwavering support for Ukraine. #StandwithUkraine https://t.co/5ixjfrlRHL

1500159882816901127.text: We are entering a critical time that will dictate the future of international peace and security. We must stand united with the Ukrainian people. My faith is with the Ukrainian people and I wish to see a peaceful end to this conflict as quickly as possible.

1500159881843781639.text: These policy changes are essential in this moment, and I will be communicating this directly to the Biden administration.

1500159880551976962.text: 2) increased sanctions, including cutting of all Mastercard and Visa credit card transactions in Russia and beginning to implement a complete embargo on all US imports of Russian oil.

1500159879385858051.text: 1) more lethal aid, including immediately transferring air defense systems, aircraft, and small arms, and

1500159878094114828.text: Specifically, I agree with President Zelensky that the U.S., the EU, and NATO should immediately provide the following support:

1500159876663816196.text: President Zelensky emphasized that Vladimir Putin is closing all independent media and we need Russians to understand what is happening in Ukraine.

1500159875573297155.text: Russians in the business community are starting to speak up, Vladimir Putin has lost his standing amongst his colleagues and Ukraine has put up and incredible fight. But President Zelensky also underlined that we need to do more to support Ukraine.

1500159874419855366.text: President Zelensky also said that it is important for us to provide Ukraine with the military equipment they need to defend themselves and that our sanctions are working--

1500159873308311558.text: And in an unbelievable, hypocritical move, Russian ordinance have struck the sacred ground of Babi Yar where a memorial stands to remember the Jewish people who were massacred there by Nazi Germany. How is this an army fighting so-called “nazification?”

1500159872108838913.text: Of the fifteen nuclear power plants in Ukraine, Russian forces have already captured two, are closing in on a third, to cause potentially a major ecological disaster in Europe.

1500159870594699270.text: Some Russian military units, including Chechen units, have turned into death squads, targeting Zelensky, his family, and other Ukrainian officials, including the mayor of Hostomel who was tortured and killed.

1500159869248319488.text: As a result, fifty children have been killed by the Russian military and the Holy Dormition Cathedral in Kharkiv has been shelled.

1500159867897753604.text: Russian military personnel are storming apartment buildings, places of worship, power plants, universities, international dormitories, and kindergartens, killing innocent people and taking hostages.

1500159866475851782.text: The Russian military is targeting the civilian population on purpose, including assassinating government officials.

1500159864479363076.text: I have just concluded a bi-partisan congressional call with President Volodomyr Zelensky to address the catastrophic implications of Vladimir Putin’s illegal and immoral attack on Ukraine. His account of the atrocities on the ground are heart-wrenching.

1483143410122993665.text: While the current status of voting rights legislation in Washington is a finite disappointment, I refuse to lose hope.

1483143409158213642.text: We owe it to Dr. King and Congressman Lewis’s memories to get this legislation passed, and we owe it to the millions of Americans impacted by this proposed legislation to get it passed before the midterm elections.

1483143408063598593.text: John Lewis addressed the March on Washington just prior to Dr. King’s infamous “I have a Dream” speech and fought every day of his life to create the more-just union he laid out while standing before the Washington Mall.

1483143406985654284.text: That quote is what I hope we can focus on in the days ahead as we fight for passage of a voting rights bill that is named after my former colleague, the late Congressman John R. Lewis.

1483143406176059400.text: One of those leaders, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., taught us to “accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.”

1483143405266173954.text: Their work weighs heavy on my mind after voting in favor of the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act last week only to see the legislation, once again, stall in the Senate.

1483143404284489736.text: There are two American heroes on my mind today – both of whom delivered speeches before the March on Washington in 1963, and both fought endlessly for the passage of the Voting Rights Act in 1965.

1460636732085477388.text: As a member of the Inuit Circumpolar Council, @dsdorough says climate impacts are adversely affecting Inuit society as it relates to food security, displacement, health difficulties, and decreased biodiversity.

1460632937767092234.text: Dr. Natali from @WoodwellClimate says the world has already warmed 1.1 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, and the Arctic is warming at least two times faster than the global average. We must act now.

1460632872004558849.text: The US needs to focus on three goals in the #Arctic: a whole-of-government approach, collective action on climate change, and preservation of indigenous communities.

1460631002007711747.text: I attended @COP26 last week and saw firsthand the need to address global climate change. Scientists predict there will be no sea ice left in the #Arctic by the end of the 21st century. We must seek to protect this strategically important region.

1460613984256774146.text: Please join me at 10am for a @HouseForeign Europe Subcommittee hearing on national security impacts of climate change in the #Arctic with @paul_zukunft @dsdorough @LukeDCoffey and Dr. Susan Natali from @WoodwellClimate https://t.co/26md3mwCXS

1457154565925658633.text: …roads, bridges (including funds that will be available for the Cape Cod Canal bridge replacement projects,) public transit, water quality, broadband access, and so much more.

1457154563463651329.text: I’ve served under three administrations, and all three have promised infrastructure deals. Yet after months of negotiations and a late night of votes, President Biden was the first to make it happen.

1436720511506124803.text: We owe it to our country, and we owe it to the thousands of innocent victims, first responders, and fallen heroes who aren’t here today because of a Tuesday morning that we will never forget. 🇺🇸

1436720510386200582.text: As we mark this solemn anniversary, I hope that we can all summon the energy to restore that sense of togetherness, patriotism, and common purpose we felt as Americans after September 11 – not just today, but every day.

1436720509358649345.text: We have had successes – Osama Bin Laden is dead, attempted terrorist attacks have been thwarted, and the world is a safer place with increased international cooperation – but those victories serve as no consolation to those who have lost a child, a spouse, a parent, or a friend.

1436720508209442816.text: We will never forget what happened on September 11. We will never forget those who lost their lives and were injured in Afghanistan and Iraq, and we will never forget the sacrifices that their families have made in the ensuing years.

1436720506984599552.text: But we must also remember how we mobilized as a nation and came together as one after September 11, and we must take that memory and move forward to see how we can work together to solve the problems we face both domestically and internationally.

1436720505822842883.text: The twentieth year of U.S. forces coming home with injuries that will impact them and their families for the rest of their lives.

1436720504522616833.text: And, sadly, as we saw just two weeks ago, it is the twentieth year of brave Americans making the ultimate sacrifice for our nation as a result of the War on Terror.

1436720503360823302.text: It’s also the twentieth year of first responders suffering from medical issues, the result of their courageously rushing through the ash and smoke to Ground Zero to save lives.

1436720502282887170.text: Today also marks the start of the twentieth year of missed birthdays for the children who never had the chance to get to know their parent, the twentieth year of missed wedding anniversaries, the twentieth year of mourning.

1436720501154516994.text: But today is not just the 20th anniversary of a cowardly attack on our nation.

1436720500005289984.text: We remember the horror we felt as we heard the news on that quiet Tuesday morning – I was in my car on my way to the office when I heard it on the radio.

1436720498688380931.text: We remember the images of falling towers, a smoldering Pentagon, and the field in Shanksville where courageous passengers and crew died as heroes.

1436720497551683585.text: We remember the more than 6,000 injured.

1436720496553480200.text: We remember the 2,977 innocent lives lost.

1431223042491957249.text: We must move forward in this mission to honor those lost yesterday, the tens of thousands killed and wounded in Afghanistan over the past two decades, and the Gold Star families they have left behind.

1431223041363742726.text: The United States will not waver in our commitment to continue the evacuation of United States citizens and Afghan allies in the face of terrorism.

1431223040277417990.text: The loss of any US service member is devastating, but these attacks, taking advantage of a precarious situation to inflict harm on U.S. personnel and desperate crowds, have underscored the brutal nature of terrorist elements in the region who we have fought so hard to eradicate.

1431223039367290886.text: The brave service members killed and wounded in the attacks at Hamid Karzai International Airport were on the front lines of an extraordinary, heroic effort. I extend my deepest condolences to the families of these heroes who have made the ultimate sacrifice for our nation.

1428852316631937027.text: I want to thank partner countries for their generous support and assistance in the Afghan evacuation operation. Citizens, visa holders, and at-risk Afghans must be kept safe and our international partners are instrumental in this effort. https://t.co/psTUPzQTeu

1427756264201900032.text: Today I joined a number of colleagues in asking @POTUS for answers about efforts to assist fleeing Afghans, including my question about rescuing activists who fought for the rights of women & girls who are now at risk. Thank you to @RepSaraJacobs for leading this effort. https://t.co/1ysRyuAMgr

1427752795130765320.text: The horrors that we are witnessing in this withdrawal can only be mitigated by the utmost effort to save those who stood with us.

1427752793507614729.text: Few can argue with the decision to end this two-decade war, but there should be no artificial timeline that constrains this effort.

1427752792081502214.text: This includes interpreters, human rights organizers, journalists, contractors, and others. We must also include those activists fighting for women’s rights in Afghanistan.

1427752789694877702.text: While two decades of political decisions will be the subject of Congressional oversight and historical review, urgent actions are necessary now to provide safe passage of U.S. Citizens and Afghan allies whose lives are in jeopardy under Taliban rule.

1427752788390522885.text: I witnessed, first hand while in-country, the efforts of our military to root out the terrorists who attacked and waged war on our homeland.

1427752786935042055.text: Thousands of American servicemembers made the ultimate sacrifice in Afghanistan, and tens of thousands more will live every day with wounds, visible or not, sustained in theater.

1427752785332867078.text: First and foremost, we must recognize and offer our deepest gratitude to the professionalism, commitment, and sacrifice of those who serve and have served in-country, and to their families here at home.

1427752317315649545.text: The most up-to-date information that we have is that flights have resumed out of the airport in Kabul and access to the airport is currently being regulated.

1427752315906371586.text: We have had some early success in assisting individuals on the ground in Afghanistan, and will continue to work to ensure that all Americans and allies are able to transit safely.

1427752314262233093.text: Our office is currently working on a number of Afghan visa cases directly with the Department of State and we stand ready to assist further as additional cases come in.

1408096334905851913.text: On @climate, @Gottemoeller says #NATO "has turned its attention to this in a significant way" after this month's summit. I wholeheartedly endorse further commitments by #NATO to combatting security impacts of @climatechange.

1408094903112974344.text: In response to a question from @RepSchneider on what Congress can do to demonstrate US commitment to #NATO, @IvoHDaalder says emphasizing that the American people stand firmly behind NATO is an important reminder that NATO meets both US & allied security interests.

1408092253776756742.text: .@RepSusanWild is asking what the US can do with @NATO allies to promote cooperation and communication with #Turkey. @AndersFoghR says "words matter" and the US should seek to prevent further Turkish-Russian military cooperation.

1408088695253737472.text: Now a question from @repdinatitus on @NATO's involvement in responding to #Russia's Arctic expansion. @AndersFoghR says NATO must adopt a clear Arctic strategy. "Russia is about to militarize the Arctic," he says.

1408080520177721347.text: Wess Mitchell says the ultimate goal must be the internal cohesion of @NATO. "The right role for #NATO is to focus on the intersection of democracy with external security threats."

1408080458848641028.text: .@GerryConnolly @natopapress is asking about military readiness beyond the 2% GDP @NATO commitment. @IvoHDaalder says "we need a fundamental recommitment to defense by our European allies... We need to spend our time talking about readiness & investments in real capabilities."

1408080276522213376.text: In response to my question on @NATO expansion, @Gottemoeller recommends "working from the inside out" through local offices on fighting domestic corruption and promoting reforms.

1408074500508368899.text: When it comes to cyber, "the best defense may be a good offense" says @IvoHDaalder. "@NATO will need to develop the doctrine and capabilities to employ cyber offensively to enhance deterrence of cyber attacks."

1408072177526657025.text: .@Gottemoeller highlights the need for a new strategic concept for @NATO to meet the challenges of this decade and beyond, continued work on burden sharing commitments, and a focus on democratic resilience.

1408070927007457303.text: Insightful words from @AndersFoghR: "@NATO has been a successful peace movement for nearly 75 years...because of two strengths: a capacity to adapt and determined American global leadership."

1408070217029226504.text: @AustinScottGA08 on the challenges facing @NATO: "As we focus on countering #China & #Russia aggression & the expansion in the Arctic, there's also an urgent need to address cyber security and cyber defense threats" posed by the two countries.

1408069104762724353.text: @GerryConnolly, President of @natopapress says, “As @NATO the SG has observed, #China demands our attention not because the alliance seeks to move into the South China Sea but because China is increasing its influence & expanding its activities in the Euro-Atlantic region.”

1408068720618995712.text: With new and emerging threats from traditional and non-traditional sources, @POTUS’ renewed commitments to our transatlantic alliances and the role of American leadership @NATO has never been more important than it is now.

1398690700426977283.text: May 28th must be remembered alongside January 6th as the day that 35 U.S. Senators, representing a minority of Americans, put their personal political future ahead of the future of our democracy.

1398690698812178439.text: The bipartisan majority voted in favor of a January 6th commission in fear of what further damage could be inflicted on our democracy. The minority used the un-democratic filibuster to block it in fear of losing elections.

1398690697910312969.text: I, along with the majority of members of the House and Senate, on a bipartisan basis and representing the vast majority of Americans, voted AGAINST doing nothing in response to the insurrection.

1398690696555601920.text: Voting to block the bipartisan 1/6 commission was the minority’s way of declaring that doing nothing is their response to keeping Capitol Police, congressional staff, and members themselves safe from future attacks.

1398690695263801345.text: Voting to block the bipartisan 1/6 commission was the minority’s way of declaring that doing nothing is their response to the greatest number of first responder injuries since September 11th.

1398690693955084289.text: Voting to block the bipartisan 1/6 commission was the minority’s way of declaring that doing nothing is their response to the death of a Capitol Police officer who came to work every day to protect them.

1398690692742909957.text: Voting to block the bipartisan 1/6 commission was the minority’s way of declaring that doing nothing is their response to an attack focused on taking hostage not just the physical documents declaring the winner of the election, but the Vice President of the United States.

1398690691430195204.text: Voting to block the bipartisan 1/6 commission yesterday was the minority’s way of declaring that doing nothing is their response to an attack on our democracy.

1398690690062749699.text: As I read the names of the 35 Senators who blocked the bipartisan 1/6 Commission, I thought of a quote of unknown origin, often misattributed to the great Irish statesman Sir Edmund Burke: “The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good people to do nothing.” https://t.co/knQuCu0Hle

This #EarthDay week:

🌎 I signed on once again to co-sponsor the #GreenNewDeal

1385283447057526789.text: We must take bold action, and @POTUS's announcement today that the US will cut emissions to half of 2005 levels in less than a decade is exactly what was needed to demonstrate that the United States in back in the leadership game when it comes to protecting our planet.

1385283446218625031.text:
Happy #EarthDay2021! 

COVID-19 has given us all a very real lesson in the importance of following the science to solve the problems we face - and it has also shown us the devastating cost of failing to act.

Reality- that is what we are dealing with here.

“So much more needs to be done”, and “new technologies are emerging.”

1384594589315706887.text:
I second @PEspinosa’s imperative point that we must focus on “women as particularly vulnerable to the effects of climate change”.
In the fight against climate change, we must continue to address the exacerbated impacts faced by those who are the most vulnerable to its effects.

1384594345731530753.text:
I fully agree with @PEspinosa that “over the long term, climate change is a  threat to humanity’s existence on this planet.” And that “nobody will escape the climate crisis unless we all address it.”
Transatlantic cooperation on climate is necessary to our very survival.

1384594308741873667.text: As @TimmermansEU explains in his testimony, “if every country would fulfill its Paris commitments”, we can make real change. #green actions will ensure “a more resilient and inclusive economy for all, with jobs that are not immediately outsourced”.

1384594268615069709.text:
@PEspinosa is clear: “The Paris Agreement is a covenant of hope for the people of the world backed by a plan of action”
“Multilateralism is…a recognition that international and domestic concerns are intertwined”- we must “build a clean, green, sustainable, and prosperous future”

1384594146317451264.text:
Together, we have to harness the power of transatlantic dialogue.
It is our responsibility to take action on climate change and to engage our global alliances to collaborate on core climate goals.
The transatlantic alliance is back, and we are looking forward, together.

1351246790239072264.text: MLK taught us that peaceful protest and protecting the right to vote are the keys to a seat at the table, not violence.

1351246788934717441.text: Then, the following day,  a violent insurrection took place that saw, among other horrors, racial slurs hurled at Black police officers, anti-Semitic screeds, and the raising of the Confederate flag - a true symbol of hate - inside the U.S. Capitol for the first time ever.

1351246787974225922.text: Two events will stand out in history from the first full week of 2021: First,  Georgia voters let freedom ring with the election of their first Black Senator, a man who preaches from the same pulpit that MLK did, and the election of their first Jewish Senator.

1351246787085037570.text: We must not just believe that the long arc of the moral universe bends towards justice - we must make it so. Black Lives Matter and honoring MLK's legacy is not about pausing one day a year in January; it's about using his words to guide us every day.

1351246785486974984.text: We do not live in the America that Martin Luther King Jr. dreamed of yet, but we have made progress - and we must protect that progress and rebuild the progress chipped away at, including the Voting Rights Act.

1146470602250825728.text: It is important to move forward with legislation to fix issues at the border, but it’s also vital to keep in mind that the President could end these horrible conditions today with a simple phone call (or tweet) to the Acting Homeland Security Secretary. https://t.co/dDejhYN1NP

1146470165082759168.text: I have also called for no further Homeland Security appropriations to implement family separation and was proud to be part of a strong Democratic coalition to block defense funds being allocated to border wall construction.

1146470163207925762.text: H.R. 3239 also requires that detainees are provided with toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap, and feminine hygiene products. It’s stunning to think that we have to legislate the provision of basic needs to refugees fleeing a humanitarian crisis, but here we are.

1146470162331242496.text: H.R. 3239 also requires that detainees receive drinking water and three meals a day and have access to an adequate number of clean and private facilities to shower, change diapers, and go to the bathroom.

1146470161228148736.text: H.R. 3239 prevents the separation of minors from their parents and requires detainees to receive a medical screening to determine their needs within twelve hours of being detained.

1146470160343228417.text: The treatment of detained immigrants dramatically highlights the need to pass H.R. 3239, which mandates basic humanitarian standards for detainees.

1146470159286177792.text: Regardless of their immigration status, every human being deserves to be treated with respect and dignity, and if the Trump administration refuses to uphold that basic American value, Congress must act – and we are.

1146470158413811712.text: The report on conditions at the border issued yesterday is gut-wrenching. Overcrowded cells, families in cages, children separated from their parents and denied showers, warm meals, and clean clothing. Many being detained longer than the 72 hours allowed by law.

As a former District Attorney, the more I digest of the Mueller Report, the harder it is to swallow:

1119234844423331841.text: The President’s “Game Over” tweet is wrong.  Defending our values of justice, impartiality, and rule of law is not a “game.” And our responsibility to protect these values will never be over.

1113910835208957954.text: We have a fundamental responsibility as a Congress to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act and a moral responsibility to ensure that funding for it never lapses again. That’s why I am a proud co-sponsor of #VAWA19, which passed today. https://t.co/4etSL8bCmK

1109214803762008064.text: Providing the public with a summarized or sanitized version of the Mueller report would only compromise confidence in our democracy - the very thing this investigation is trying to protect.

1109214802914799616.text: The purpose of the Mueller investigation was to investigate threats and attacks to our democracy. The public should have full access to all the information in the Mueller report, absent any material that would compromise intelligence sources or methods.

1102977570017026048.text: This week we’re going to introduce legislation to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act, and restore net neutrality. We're also going to pass H.R. 1 – the For the People Act to work to restore the American people’s faith in our government. #VAWA #NetNeutrality

1102977569299841024.text: Last week we passed two common-sense gun safety bills, voted to terminate the President’s emergency declaration, and we introduced legislation to restore the Voting Rights Act.

1085330087543635969.text: I look forward to leading important work in the House of Representatives to reaffirm our NATO membership and am confident that oversight over President Trump's impulsive decisions on this critical security issue will be vigorously pursued here in Congress.

1085330085861867522.text: Withdrawing from NATO would create one of the most dangerous security voids of our lifetimes serving only to empower those who would strive to weaken the United States and undermine the world order the we have spent the last half of the twentieth century building with our allies.

1085330084658061317.text: NATO is a cornerstone of our efforts to keep Americans safe here at home and let us not forget that NATO Article 5 has only been invoked once in its history - in the collective defense of the United States after 9/11.

1085330083169083395.text: The President's willingness to discard our longstanding NATO alliance without consulting Congress or our allies is disturbing. That there was discussion of this prospect alone is alarming, damages our credibility with our European allies, and leaves us less secure.

1083139585578885121.text: I am proud to join on as a co-sponsor of #HR8 today and stand with all survivors of gun violence whose lives might be different had we had smart gun laws already in place.

1083139584714772480.text: Rep. Giffords was also in Washington for the announcement of H.R. 8 – “To require a background check for every firearm sale” which was introduced by a bipartisan group of five Democrats and five Republicans.

1083139582638653440.text: Gabby is a hero – and it was my great honor to be able to convey that message this morning when I spoke with her outside the newly-dedicated Gabrielle Giffords-Leo J. Ryan Cloakroom at the Capitol. https://t.co/fqBfRXKZLb

1045433991917121537.text: As a former District Attorney who has worked with victims of sexual assault, I realize the excruciating and retraumatizing nature of sharing the type of experience Dr. Ford has disclosed. I cannot begin to understand doing that on a national stage.

1045433990608551936.text: Yet, for a lifetime appointment to one of our nation’s most important positions, federal investigators are not being allowed to do this. That outrage is only matched by the courage of Dr. Ford in coming forward.

1045433989123772416.text: I was fortunate to be able to pay my way through college working for the Post Office. For that job, federal investigators conducted a background check, even going door to door in the neighborhood I grew up in and asking residents what they knew of me.

989211857314512896.text: Lana Jones knew everyone, and everyone who knew Lana knew her to be smart, kind, thorough, and great at her job. I had the pleasure of being interviewed by her many times over the years and I can say with certainty that Boston has lost one of its best reporters.

86470127381520384.text: Thank you to everyone that participated in theTwitterTownhall! Look forward to seeing you around the district (or Twitter)! #ma10 #AskBill

86465508769144832.text: I’m not focused on building hosp./schools in I&A; we need to get to a point where these govs can stand on their own. #AskBill

86464466639790080.text: @chrismatth Are our contributions to Iraqi & Afghani infrastructure noticeable and appreciated? Good schools, hospitals, roads? #AskBill

86463938904072192.text: This region is ripe for bold moves from the people, not any one leader – just as we saw in Tahrir Square.  #AskBill

86462600765915136.text: @StevenL57 Do you see any opportunity in the Middle East for someone to make a bold move, similar to Begin/Sadat? #askBill #ma10

86462084241567744.text: From what I saw, local officials seem willing & eager to take responsibility for their country, & it’s time we let them to do that. #AskBill

86461662525272064.text: @CeejChapman ? What was your impression of the power transfer between our forces and local officials in Iraq? How is it going? #AskBill

86460670203269120.text: Iraq war gave Iran opportunity for influence in a strategic region for US, & now we need to deal w/consequences.#AskBill

86460482940190720.text: @job4338 ? wht is ur opinion on the future of Iraq-Iran relations following US's withdrawal from Iraq? #AskBill

86458764449939456.text: Even w/most of our troops out, Iraq remains 1 of most dangerous places in world. Sgt. Matthew Gallagher is tragic reminder of that. #AskBill

86457513800765440.text: @kelleryjones ? Can you tell us how smoothly (or bumpy) the overall transitions are going in Iraq? Did you see much progress? #AskBill #ma10

86456955098497024.text: Now that StateDept is leading transition, American face that Iraqis & Afghanis will see is thankfully not going to be a helmet & gun#AskBill

86456616370700288.text: @kelleryjones ? Did you return from Iraq/Afghanistan with a more optimistic view in terms of an eventual transition? #AskBill #ma10

86454171401859072.text: No country in Middle East/South Asia are the same.  We need to treat each leadership differently & allocate resources accordingly. #AskBill

86453659344441344.text: @joshcutler #AskBill how do Iran & Afghanistan differ in terms of infrastructure, both physical & in terms of govt institutions?

86452936187715584.text: Our primary focus needs to be protecting ourselves from retaliatory acts. Bin-Laden’s death is does not equal death of terrorism. #AskBill

86452802230026240.text: @afertig Hey #AskBill I'm wondering what your thoughts are on how to redefine our mission in afghanistan post-Bin Laden.

86441774385602560.text: I am having some technical issues.  Will get started shortly!  Thanks for your patience. #AskBill
